posts.name: Hi
posts.cooked: Our rev pdh is showing a “sticky fault” which apparently is symptomatic of an internal electrical problem, and we don’t have a replacement. We have cleared the faults via wpilib, power cycled the PDH, and pressed the onboard “mode” button to no avail. Our first competition is in a week, and we think we may have to go back to a PDP and remove traversal functionality from our climber in order to save on slots. Are there any teams out there with a spare PDH which they would be willing to sell us? We are not asking for a donation, we are willing to pay significantly above MSRP. Shoot me a DM if you might be  to help us out. Thanks in advance.

posts.name: Troy Dietz
posts.cooked: REV support should be able to help you with a replacement for a dead PDH.

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: The pdh should still work just fine, if you’re ok with it showing a sticky fault. The faults don’t affect the functionality.

posts.name: Hi
posts.cooked:
Ryan_Blue:

if you’re ok with it showing a sticky fault

this part is concerning to me. I feel like if we get the wrong inspector they’re gonna see it as a problem and then were kinda screwed…

posts.name: alst
posts.cooked:
A sticky fault is an indication of a fault that has happened at some point in the past. It’s not necessarily indicitave of a current issue. REV has documentation here on how to clear sticky fault indicators, so I suggest that you try that and see if the sticky fault comes back.

As a side note, at least 50% of CTRE PDP’s I’ve ever seen have had a sticky fault indicator because people don’t tend to clear them. I’m less familiar with the REV PDH, but I would be surprised if the issue is internal to the PDH, and I wouldn’t jump to replacing the PDH just yet.

link_counts.title: Power Distribution Hub Troubleshooting - Power Distribution Hub

posts.name: Hi
posts.cooked: It is also indicated that there is a fault with all the fuses and 4 of the breakers in the PDH. The fault indicates there should be no voltage at the terminals but upon inspection with a multimeter we have found this not to be the case. Nevertheless, many of the lights on the PDH indicate both active and sticky faults. As far as we can see it seems functional though.

posts.cooked:

Here is what it looks like. The status light is alternating blinking cyan and orange.

posts.name: Sunny, Leveson
posts.cooked: If the inspector complains about that it’s A not illegal and B when you should escalate to the lri it may not be advisable or functional but that doesn’t make it illegal. And in this case it’s neither inadvisable or illegal

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: There is no rule or item on the inspection checklist that requires devices to be free of sticky faults.

If you have REV hardware client plug into the PDH and clear sticky faults. The sticky faults are not a problem. They are just telling you that the PDH reset or something else. If it shows you have a active fault then that is a problem. Otherwise you should be completely fine.

posts.name: Hi
posts.cooked: Just did that. It shows that there are hardware active and sticky faults. Everything seems to work fine now, and the status light is normal. Is this ok?

posts.name: Hi
posts.cooked: It still says several breakers are “tripped or missing” even though they are there, and there is power coming from the terminals
Have you triple checked your breakers are actually seated properly? Did you check your faults again to clear them and then power cycle?

posts.name: Nick Coussens
posts.cooked: I recommend emailing REV support directly if you are having issues clearing the sticky faults and I’m sure they will promptly respond to you with help.

I am not entirely sure about this and Rev support would probably be the best resource but if you are not using all of your breaker slots that could be why it is saying they are missing. You should probably contact REV support though.

posts.name: Hadi379
posts.cooked: This is technically acceptable according to REV from my experience.  I think the biggest issue that may cause problems is if you are not able to change the CAN ID to anything but 1 through the REV client.  Try changing the PDH CAN ID to 3 (or anything else) through the client, Save it, power down the PDH, Power it back up and see if that value stored.  If it doesnt store the new CAN ID, you may have a hardware issue.
